meanings.definition: To perceive or become aware of
meanings.sent1: She cognised the sound of the doorbell ringing.
meanings.sent2: The detective cognised the subtle clues at the crime scene.
meanings.sent3: The cat cognised the presence of a mouse in the room.
meanings.sent4: His intuition cognised the underlying truth of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The child cognised the beauty of the rainbow in the sky.

meanings.sent1: He quickly cognised the meaning of the unfamiliar word.
meanings.sent2: The teacher cognised the student's confusion and offered help.
meanings.sent3: The robot cognised the command and executed it flawlessly.
meanings.sent4: She finally cognised the importance of time management.
meanings.sent5: The team cognised the opponent's strategy and adjusted their own.

meanings.definition: To have knowledge or awareness of
meanings.sent1: They cognised the history of the ancient civilization.
meanings.sent2: The scientist cognised the breakthrough in the research field.
meanings.sent3: The explorer cognised the dangers lurking in the uncharted territory.
meanings.sent4: The professor cognised the significance of the newly discovered theory.
meanings.sent5: The doctor cognised the symptoms and diagnosed the illness accurately.
